points.name: CN Tower
points.script: Welcome to CN Tower! This is where your journey begins.

points.name: Nathan Phillips Square
points.script: Hey there! Welcome to Nathan Phillips Square, the heart of Toronto! This vibrant space is more than just a pretty park. Did you know that this iconic fountain freezes in the winter, creating an amazing skating rink? Plus, see those concrete arches? They're actually called "The Arches" and they're super popular for photos. Take a stroll, soak up the atmosphere, maybe grab a bite from one of the vendors, and definitely take a moment to explore the public art or just people-watch. Enjoy!

points.name: Art Gallery of Ontario
points.script: Hey everyone, welcome to the Art Gallery of Ontario, or the AGO as we locals call it! Get ready to be amazed. This place houses over 90,000 works, from iconic Canadian art like the Group of Seven to masterpieces by European masters and cutting-edge contemporary pieces. Did you know the AGO's spiral staircase was designed by Frank Gehry, the same architect behind the Guggenheim Museum Bilbao? Pretty cool, huh? So, go ahead, get lost in the colours, stories, and perspectives. What will you discover? Observe and Enjoy!

points.name: Royal Ontario Museum
points.script:
Hey everyone, welcome to the Royal Ontario Museum! Get ready for an adventure through time and culture.

Did you know the ROM houses over 13 million artifacts and artworks? We've got everything from dinosaur skeletons, including "Gordo" the Barosaurus, to ancient Egyptian mummies and stunning Chinese art. 

We'll only have a short time, but keep an eye out for the imposing totem poles in the First Peoples gallery, or the dazzling Michael Lee-Chin Crystal itself - a truly unique architectural marvel.

Now, let's dive in! Take your time to explore and observe. There's something amazing around every corner.

points.name: Casa Loma
points.script: Alright, welcome to Casa Loma! Isn't it magnificent? Can you believe this opulent castle was built in the early 1900s? Sir Henry Pellatt, a Canadian financier, dreamed it up, and no detail was spared. Did you know it features secret passages, stables under the main floor, and even an unfinished swimming pool? Now, I encourage you to wander through these grand halls, imagine what life was like, and maybe even uncover a secret or two yourself!

points.name: CN Tower
points.script: Hey everyone, welcome to the CN Tower! Get ready for breathtaking views! Did you know we were the tallest freestanding structure in the world for over 30 years? Pretty cool, right? We're going to zoom up in an elevator that travels at a brisk 22 km/h! At the top, you'll find incredible observation decks and even a revolving restaurant. So, take a deep breath, grab your cameras, and get ready to explore Toronto from a whole new perspective. Don't forget to look down... if you dare!

points.name: CN Tower
points.script: Welcome to CN Tower! This is where your journey begins.
